Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can illustrate a plant that has enough water to show it living and growing.
The student can illustrate a plant that does not have water to show it not living or growing.
The student can demonstrate through their drawing how the presence or absence of water affects a plant.
The student can identify and label parts of a plant in their drawings, showing the presence or absence of water.
The student can illustrate a plant in a bright environment with light to show it living and growing.
The student can show the contrast by illustrating a plant in a place without light (like under a rock) and demonstrate its struggle to live or grow.
The student can represent the concept that plants need water and light by drawing environments that provide these needs.
